revision.text:
==English== ===Etymology=== Perhaps from {{suffix|en|yester|en}}. Compare also {{cog|ang|ġiestran||yesterday}}. ===Adjective=== {{en-adj|-}} # {{lb|en|archaic|rare}} Of or pertaining to [[yesterday]]. #* '''1868''', John Conington (translator), ''The Iliad of Homer'' #*: Argos, I fear, will pay us soon again
Her '''yestern''' debt{{...}} #* {{quote-book |en |year=1970 |year_published= |edition= |editor= |author=Trumbull Stickney |title=Dramatic Verses |chapter= |url=http://books.google.com/books?id=MP_IxKA1vsQC&pg=PA35&dq=%22yestern%22&hl=en&sa=X&ei=8g0_UeT9BuaL0QHQ8IHgDA&redir_esc=y#v=onepage&q=%22yestern%22&f=false |genre= |publisher=Ardent Media |isbn=9780839818724 |page=35 |passage=For men born of yesterday are '''yestern''' }} ===Adverb=== {{en-adv|-}} # {{lb|en|archaic}} [[yesterday|Yesterday]]. #* {{quote-book |en |year=1949 |year_published= |edition= |editor= |author=Lionel Trilling |title=Matthew Arnold |chapter= |url=http://books.google.com/books?id=Q9QOAAAAQAAJ&pg=PA169&dq=%22yestern%22&hl=en&sa=X&ei=h0U_UcCbKYqB0AGdrYGwBw&redir_esc=y#v=onepage&q=%22yestern%22&f=false |genre= |publisher=Taylor & Francis |isbn=9780049280182 |page=169 |passage="F. Newman's book I saw '''yestern''' at our ouse," Arnold writes to Clough. "He seems to have written himself down an hass. }} ===Noun=== {{en-noun}} # {{lb|en|archaic}} [[yesterday|Yesterday]]. #* {{quote-book |en |year=1839 |year_published='''2006''' |edition=Digitized |editor=Montagu Montagu |author=Johann Christoph Friedrich von Schiller |title=The Song of the Bell, and other Poems |chapter=Knight Toggenburg |url=http://books.google.com/books?id=sdcDAAAAQAAJ&pg=PA84&dq=%22yestern%22&hl=en&sa=X&ei=h0U_UcCbKYqB0AGdrYGwBw&redir_esc=y#v=onepage&q=%22yestern%22&f=false |genre= |publisher= |isbn= |page=85 |passage='''Yestern''' was the day of hail, {{...}} }} #* {{quote-book |en |year=1840 |year_published='''2012''' |edition=Digitized |editor= |author=Amelia Lane |title=The Fortress: An Historical Tale of the Fifteenth Century |chapter= |url=http://books.google.com/books?id=dDg1AQAAMAAJ&pg=PA305&dq=%22yestern%22&hl=en&sa=X&ei=h0U_UcCbKYqB0AGdrYGwBw&redir_esc=y#v=onepage&q=%22yestern%22&f=false |genre= |publisher= |isbn= |page=305 |passage='''Yestern''', who was there could compete with me in strength? }} #* {{quote-book |en |year=1977 |year_published='''2009''' |edition=Digitized |editor= |author=Bill Reed |title=Dogod |chapter= |url=http://books.google.com/books?id=ccdHAAAAYAAJ&q=%22yesterns%22&dq=%22yesterns%22&hl=en&sa=X&ei=kE8_UfeCKen-0gGbp4HwBA&redir_esc=y |genre= |publisher= |isbn=9780170051460 |page=76 |passage=For this day ought to promise not so much mulch as yesterday or all the other '''yesterns''' all back in a row of boredowndom. }} #* {{quote-book |en |year=2011 |year_published= |edition= |editor= |author=Glenn P. Wolfe |title=Mneme's Place: Book One |chapter= |url=http://books.google.com/books?id=gbRH1bScT5kC&pg=PA22&dq=%22yestern%22&hl=en&sa=X&ei=h0U_UcCbKYqB0AGdrYGwBw&redir_esc=y#v=onepage&q=%22yestern%22&f=false |genre=fiction |publisher=iUniverse |isbn=9781462017157 |page=22 |passage=Jestern, was Joyce's '''yestern'''. }} ====Translations==== {{trans-top|yesterday}} * Persian: {{t+|fa|دینه|tr=dine|sc=fa-Arab}} * Russian: {{t+|ru|вчера́шний|m}} {{trans-mid}} * Spanish: {{t|es|ayereño}} {{trans-bottom}} ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|en|a=eenrsty|sentery|styrene}}
